item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Freddy1990:

Try not to use the Sleep api in a main thread, it’s messy…

Explain to me how a single function is an API?
I’d say it’s only messy for GUI programming, with the terminal, it doesn’t really matter.

you contradict yourself.

and dont worry about all the sarcasm, theres nuggets of information in all those flames

item.title: C++ Auto-Clicker (Simple)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:8, topic:233752”][quote author=zstars link=topic=308230.msg2467457#msg2467457 date=1222802668]
That code is fkin scary. And x and y are not initialized.
[/quote]And C++ allows this…?[/quote]

They are declared, so it probably does allow it. The problem for you is that you do not know what value they hold, it is most likely just garbage.

item.title: C++ Auto-Clicker (Simple)
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Daed, post:1, topic:233752”][code]
cout << “\nStarting in 5…”;
Sleep(1000);

  cout << "\nStarting in 4..";

Sleep(1000);

  cout << "\nStarting in 3..";

Sleep(1000);

  cout << "\nStarting in 2..";

Sleep(1000);

  cout << "\nStarting in 1..";

Sleep(1000);
[/code][/quote]

try this

for(int f = 5; f > 0; f--) {
    cout << "Starting in " << f << "..\n";
    Sleep(1000);
}

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Auto-Clicker (Simple)
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Hey, i’ve started learning C++ again, and this is the first program i have made so far 

#include <iostream>
#include <windows.h>
using namespace std;

int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
   int n = 1;
   int x;
   int y;
   int times;
   int done;
   int sleepy;
   string choice;
   
start:
      
      cout << "Htaed Auto Clicker\n";
      cout << "Version 1.0";
      cout << "\n\nHow many times would you like to click?\n";
      cout << "    : ";
      
      cin >> times;
      
      cout << "\nHow much time should i wait inbetween clicks?\n";
      cout << "(MS): ";
      
      cin >> sleepy;
      done = 0;
      
      cout << "\nStarting in 5..";
   Sleep(1000);
   
      cout << "\nStarting in 4..";
   Sleep(1000);
   
      cout << "\nStarting in 3..";
   Sleep(1000);
   
      cout << "\nStarting in 2..";
   Sleep(1000);
   
      cout << "\nStarting in 1..";
   Sleep(1000);
   
        while (done <= times)
              {
                 Sleep(sleepy);
                 mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTDOWN, x, y, 0, 0);
                 mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTUP, x, y, 0, 0);
                 done++;
             } 
    
      cout << "\n\nAuto-Clicking finished.";
      cout << "\n\n(y/n) Again: ";
      
      cin >> choice;
    
            if (choice == "y")
                {
                       system("cls");
                       goto start;
                }
            
      cin.get();
}

Read full topic
